title: Report Bulk endpoint "agree-on-going-public" action may reveal Report disclosure state for invite-only programs

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello,
 Hope you are doing well,
                                                                                                                                    SUMMARY
->In hackerone user doesn't have permission to do any action like "disclosing/undiclosing" in disclosed report.
->Here user can send the "cancel-disclosure-request" request to the server and server accepts the request gave 200ok response with 
                               "{"flash":"The request to disclose the report has been cancelled."}"
->Here server didn't validate the report ID, so that user can perform this action successfully..
->But sadly the response was updated in disclosed report, but you can clearly see in the response "cancellation has been done " properly.

                                                                                                                                    STEP TO REPRODUCE
1.Take a disclosed report in your account,
2.Basically you don't have permission to capture the "cancel-disclosure-report",
3.So that take an another report which wasn't disclosed, And now request for the disclosure and capture the request in burp repeater,
4.Now again request for "cancel-disclosure-request" and capture it send it to the repeater..
                                                                                                                                   Cancel-disclosure-request
POST /reports/bulk HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:89.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/89.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=901468&view=pending_disclosure&filters%5B%5D=not-public&filters%5B%5D=going-public-user&filters%5B%5D=going-public-team&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1
X-CSRF-Token: ██████
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 184
Origin: https://hackerone.com
Connection: close
Cookie: █████
Sec-GPC: 1

message=hi&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=true&reply_action=cancel-disclosure-request&mark_ineligible_for_bounty=false&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=1078081&bounty_currency=USD
======================================================================================================================
5.Now go to repeater change the value "report_id"  to already disclosed report_id,
        My disclosed report_id:1078081
6.And send it to the server.. as you can see server accepts the request and reuqested to cancellation of disclosure of that report.
7.So after that I've try to request for disclosure for  that report, server response is report has been disclosed.
8.But when you try again for cancellation of disclosure server response is similar for older one(6th point).

## Impact

-> By this user has escalated his privileges and Done some action which were not supposed to do.
 ->IN hacker one No one has permission to cancel the disclosure the report after disclosing it.
 ->But Here user bypassed it and requested for cancellation..
 If I've done any mistake please be excuse my mistakes, And for better understanding I've attached Video POC and some pictures too..
 Thank you.
 @clubbable

activities.message:
Hi @clubbable,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@glassofbeer

Hello @glassofbeer ,
 Hope you are doing well, thank you for warm response.
 Discuss the one by one..
1.Yes I've used session/cookies from original reporter.. after disclosure of any report even original reporter doesn't have option "disclosure request" & "Cancel the disclosure" right?
 ->So Here I've bypass the thing and sent request to the server right..!
 ->Here actually server should restrict the request..
2.When I request for disclosure server response is "The report has been disclosed" this thing I've shown in my video POC, After doing this..
 ->When I requested for cancel the disclosure server response is "The request to disclose the report has been cancelled".. Here the report has been disclosed right and I can't request for disclose.. Than what kind of request has been cancelled in backend..?
3.I'm already mentioned that these action were not updated in report.. But as you can see the server is responding to my request...!
============================================================================================================
 IMPACT:
1.disclosed report has restriction to do not cancel the disclosure.. And also user doesn't have those option in report.. But Here I'm bypassed those things right..!
2.If server didn't responded to those request I'm sure that I won't report to you about this, But server response is as like as responded to undisclosed report..!
3.I don't know why these action were not updated in report.. this is only thing which I'm missing here..
============================================================================================================ Thank you, Hope I cleared all your questions.
@abhiram

Hello @glassofbeer ,
 I've found another bug which is relater to this report..!
Attacker can brute force that request to know whether the report is disclosed or not.. 
 Here Attacker gives "1 - 1217918" in report id section to know the disclosure state of every report..
 If a report wasn't disclosed the response is like "Disclosure has been requested."
 If a report was disclosed the response is like "The report has been disclosed."
 So By this attacker knows which report is disclosed..

Now you can say that "what was the problem in it, every thing is perfect"..! right..?
 
Now coming to point.
1. In hacker one there are some private bug bounty programs which enables the private disclosure..!
2. And it kept secret and unauthorized person didn't know about status of the private disclosure..Right!
3. Here what I've done is I've requested for disclosure of privately disclosed report!

POST /reports/bulk HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:89.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/89.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1134207&view=pending_disclosure&filters%5B%5D=not-public&filters%5B%5D=going-public-user&filters%5B%5D=going-public-team&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1
X-CSRF-Token: ████████
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 178
Origin: https://hackerone.com
Connection: close
Cookie: █████
Sec-GPC: 1

message=&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=false&reply_action=agree-on-going-public&mark_ineligible_for_bounty=false&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=592759&bounty_currency=USD
 
 Here the report_id is belong to private bugbounty program "Therealreal" which is ready to disclose the report privately.. and the report has been disclosed!
 I've requested with "@Clubbable" credentials to know about the status of report..!
 *and surprisingly i got response "The report has been disclosed."

 Here unauthorized person also will know the status of privately disclosed report!

 This is the vulnerability which I've found toda.
 
 And also Thank you @clubbable for helping me get this report!

@abhiram
Its pleasure to work with you @abhiram :)

Hello @glassofbeer ,
 Sorry for late response..!
->Please consider @abhiram comments "https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1219011&view=open&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=pending-program-review&substates%5B%5D=triaged&substates%5B%5D=pre-submission&substates%5B%5D=retesting&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1#activity-12082971"
-> @abhiram  explained the layers of this bug and how attacker will know about privately disclosed report..!
-> The response which we are getting for disclosure report should be rectified,
-> And you should restrict the user for getting information of the all reports..
Thank you.
@clubbable

Hey @clubbable,

Thank you for your report!

After review, there doesn’t seem to be any security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing. There is nothing to be gained from what is being described here, from an attacker's perspective and this poses no actual risk overall.

If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Kind regards,
@glassofbeer
sorry

Hello @glassofbeer ,
 I thought that @abhiram didn't explained properly about bug in the comment "https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1219011&view=all&substates%5B%5D=editing&substates%5B%5D=pre-submission&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=triaged&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=resolved&substates%5B%5D=informative&substates%5B%5D=not-applicable&substates%5B%5D=duplicate&substates%5B%5D=spam&substates%5B%5D=retesting&substates%5B%5D=pending-program-review&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1#activity-12082971"
 And I don't know whether You're consider his comments or not..!
 That's why I'm again contacting you..!
 
 Lets elaborate the issue Again..!
1.Logged in As a clubbable in hacker one and captured the request of disclosure,
2.And opened the link "https://hackerone.com/reports/592759" to know the response,
3.And response I've got is like "Oops! You can't access this report because it isn't public yet." And Here I don't know whether the report is disclosed or not right..! And seriously hacker one restrict me to know the status of the report..!
4.Now I've changed the value of report_id:592759 in disclosure request and sent in burp _repeater,
5.The response for the disclosure request is"The report has been disclosed."
 Here you can clearly see that I got to know the status of report with Help of "Insecure direct object references"  ..!

 Why I can't see the report is :
->It's belongs to private program and that private program accepts the private disclosure..!

What I've got from this :
->I got to know that the report is belongs to private bug bounty and the report has been disclosed privately..!

Impact:
1.Any user in hacker one can know the status of report which disclosed privately!
2.If Report is public we can access page,But here the page isn't visible so that you can imagine that the report is belongs to private program.

Thank you.

@clubbable

Hi @jobert ,
 I just requesting you to review my report, Because I don't enough signal to reach you by comments..!
 Please consider my comment and I believe this an issue to be Traiged..!
 "https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1219011&view=all&substates%5B%5D=editing&substates%5B%5D=pre-submission&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=triaged&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=resolved&substates%5B%5D=informative&substates%5B%5D=not-applicable&substates%5B%5D=duplicate&substates%5B%5D=spam&substates%5B%5D=retesting&substates%5B%5D=pending-program-review&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1#activity-12139301"
  *And again I know that hacker one not disclosing informative bugs, Please be excuse about this..! Thank you :)
@clubbable

Hi @jobert @glassofbeer ,

 Lets dive into the vulnerability..
->Yeah I know that attacker need to put lot of time get this vulnerability,
->First capture the token of https://hackerone.com/reports/bulk and send it to burp_intruder,
->In that token select report_id as an attacker vector, select payload from 0-12139301,
->And start the attack, most of the report are not disclosed, if the report is disclosed the response is like "report has been disclosed".
->So Here as an attacker I'm taking those report which I've got response like "report has been disclosed" and place the report URL in browser to know whether its visible or not..!
->If it's visible so that report is public report or else If the report doesn't have access so that the report is privately disclosed,
->So by this attacker knows how many reports are privately disclosed,
->And also attacker know that particular report which is privately disclosed..!

And Due to this long process, I've taken help from @abhiram He gave me privately disclosed report ID and I tested in Https://hackerone.com/reports/bulk
 And rest is already I've mentioned earlier in this report..! Hope you got my point

Thank you @abhiram @jobert @glassofbeer .

@clubbable

@clubbable

I understand the scenario but this pose no risk at all and reveal nothing to the attacker. They can't infer nothing out of this behavior.

>What I've got from this :
->I got to know that the report is belongs to private bug bounty and the report has been disclosed privately..!

That's not true. It can be anything, it can be a report in a public program but reported by another hacker. You only have access to the report you submitted or collaborated, all other reports are there, "private" in a way that you cannot access, but knowing those reports exist means nothing,

Report numbers are numerical and sequential...all reports a private in a way.

This pose no risk and the initial assessment still stands. This shall remain closed as it is.

Kind Regards,
@glassofbeer

Hi @clubbable - it seems like you've stumbled upon a false positive. The `/reports/bulk` endpoint doesn't handle unauthorized requests really well, so it will return 200 OK responses for many different actions that the user can make. You'll notice that if you'd try to cancel a disclosure request for a report that you're not the reporter or program member of, it won't actually cancel the request, even though the backend said it did. Because of that, I don't believe that this is a valid security vulnerability. Please let me know if you believe I missed something.

Hi @jobert ,
 Really  Happy to see you here,
1.Yes You're /reports/bulk endpoint is giving false-positive response for cancellation of request,
2.But when You give disclosed report ID to "request for disclosure" in that endpoint, The response is "Report has been disclosed",
3.At the same time when we give undisclosed report id to the endpoint it gives us false-positive statement, Here you clearly see that if the report is disclosed publicly or privately the response of the end point is "Report has been disclosed"
4.Even the report is privately disclosed the response of the endpoint is "Report has been disclosed",
5.In hackerone some of programs allowing private disclosure like "Urbancompany",
6.For an example "https://hackerone.com/reports/592759" if try to access the page the response is "oops the report isn't public yet",
7.But the end point response is "report has been disclosed",
8.Yes the endpoint is response correct, because the report "592759" has been disclosed privately,
9.Here my point is if the end point response is like "report has been disclosed" but the page isn't accessible so that the report is privately disclosed,
10.By this As an attacker I can trace out each and every private disclose report..!

Impact:
1. Attacker can know how many reports are privately disclosed and the report_id too,

Thank you and hope you understand my point.
@clubbable

Hi @clubbable - from what I can see, it always gives that response, unless you have access to it. I'm unfortunately still not seeing how this discloses any information, so I'm inclined to say that we'll close this matter and move on. If you think I'm still missing something, please let me know. Thanks!

Hi @jobert ,
 Sorry sir I haven't explained well in above comments, This is my mistake and I try to elaborate the report completely..!
 Hackerone user got to know that the report is privately disclosed.. :: This is the present scenario of the report (1219011) ::

For this "/reports/bulk Request for the disclosure" endpoint is used to know that the report is disclosed privately..!

Description:
 If the report is privately disclosed than the response of the report is similar to the undisclosed report : Access denied "The report isn't public yet" 
 And No one knows thats the report is disclosed privately unless until the user works for that private program.

 Here any user can trace out which report is privately disclosed with the use of "/reports/bluk" endpoint..!

Step to reproduce:

1.Capture the request of /reports/bulk for request for disclosure and send it to the repeater,
2.Here I've taken 3 reports for example :
A.246838  : already disclosed report and its public,
B.1214007 : non disclosed report,
C.592759  : privately disclosed report and its secret,
3.Lets send those report_id in /reports/bulk endpoint and lets elaborate the responses,
A.246838  : "The report has been disclosed"
B.1214007 : "Request for disclosure"
C.592759  : "The report has been disclosed"
4.As you can see here response for A&C reports response is same and B is different,
5.so lets check these response in browser...
A : Report is accessable.
B : The Report isn't public yet.
C : The Report isn't public yet.
 Here conclusion is Report "C" is disclosed but isn't public yet so that the report is belongs to private program and disclosed privately.

Now Attacker can repeat the process for each and every report than attacker know that how many reports disclosed privately. Because in hackerone report_id are sequencial. right..!

========================================================================================================
 REPORT : A
POST /reports/bulk HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:89.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/89.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1096488&view=pending_disclosure&filters%5B%5D=not-public&filters%5B%5D=going-public-user&filters%5B%5D=going-public-team&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1
X-CSRF-Token: ██████████==
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 178
Origin: https://hackerone.com
Connection: close
Cookie: █████████
Sec-GPC: 1

message=&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=false&reply_action=agree-on-going-public&mark_ineligible_for_bounty=false&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=246838&bounty_currency=USD
==========================================================================================================
For REPORT B&C change the report_id and see the response

Hi @clubbable - thanks for the additional context, that was super useful! I looked into this again and something funky is happening here. I was looking at the actual action that cancels the disclosure request. But this doesn't show the behavior you're describing. However, when the action was called, a piece of code seems to fetch some state information from the reports again, seemingly bypassing an authorization check. We'll investigate and thanks for being persistent!
Thank you @jobert ,

Hi @jobert ,
 Once again thank you for triaging the report..!

Yes the endpoint doesn't show about private disclosure,

Attacker assumes like this :
When random id placed in that endpoint send it to the server:
scenario 1 : If response is like "The report has been disclosed" and its accessible in browser than its publicly disclosed,
scenario 2 : If response is like "Requested for disclosure" the report is not disclosed,
scenario 3 : If response is like "The report has been disclosed" but its not accessible in browser than its privately disclosed.

 If the scenario 3 is happening for any report_id than the report is privately disclosed, By this state information of report attacker assuming that the report is disclosed publicly or privately..!

 Like this I've tested for 592759 which response is like scenario 3 and It's privately or limited disclosed report(@abhiram suggested me to check this report_id to achieve this) 

Here The attacker need to assume like this too achieve Privately disclosure report ID.

Thank you and hope you understand my Point..!

@clubbable

Hi @clubbable - yeah, I'm following. What threw me off was that the initial report said that the `cancel-disclosure-request` was the vulnerable action, but it's `agree-on-going-public`. Maybe you realized this later yourself too, but that caused the confusion. We'll get back to you soon. Thanks!

Hi @jobert ,
 Thank you for following all comments,
 If you see "https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1219011&view=open&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=pending-program-review&substates%5B%5D=triaged&substates%5B%5D=pre-submission&substates%5B%5D=retesting&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1#activity-12234968" in this comments it reveal more information than the actual reveal of the /reports/bulk/ endpoint, That's my point..!

@clubbable
Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!
Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!

additional_data.old_title: User can perform  the action "cancel-disclosure-request" for disclosed report
additional_data.new_title: Report Bulk endpoint "agree-on-going-public" action may reveal Report disclosure state for invite-only programs

activities.message:
@jobert ,

Thank you very much :), And hope you consider my above comments :)
Hi @clubbable - yeah, I think I'm following. I suspect that we'll have a fix live today or Monday. We'll get back to you soon!

Hi @jobert ,
 Once again thank you for following my comments,
  I thought the report is comes under medium severity issue because this "https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1219011#activity-12234968",
 That's why I'm mentioning about those comments, and ask for consideration..! 
 And now severity is set to low and bounty is also paid so I'm bit scared due to this report may remains low.! Now you'll get my point

Thank you.
@clubbable
Hi @clubbable - we pushed a fix. Can you retest this? Thanks!
For context: we expect every report ID you're not authorized for to say that disclosure has been requested.
Privately disclosed report_id '592759' place in /reports/bulk endpoint "agree-on-going-public" and response is like "disclosure has been requested"
Thanks for confirming the fix!

Hello
Thank you for $50 bounty,
And Disclose this report without content and bounty information.

@clubbable

Hi @clubbable - as per our policy, reports a publicly disclosed in full. Is there any particular information you don't want to be publicly disclosed? We're happy to redact something. So far, I've removed the session cookies, CSRF tokens, and screen recordings. Let me know if this is good to go. If we don't hear from you, the report will automatically be fully disclosed in 27 days.
